data_sources.description: Contains interaction data from users, including timestamps, user IDs, and content IDs.

data_variables.name: data
data_variables.description: DataFrame containing interaction records filtered for question type interactions.

data_variables.name: data_q
data_variables.description: Filtered DataFrame containing only question-type interactions from the original data.

data_variables.name: users_i_counts
data_variables.description: Series containing the count of interactions per user.

data_variables.name: user_list
data_variables.description: List of user IDs derived from the users_i_counts.

data_variables.name: train_data
data_variables.description: DataFrame containing training data selected from data_q based on user interactions.

data_variables.name: valid_data
data_variables.description: DataFrame containing validation data selected from data_q based on user interactions.

data_variables.name: user_num
data_variables.description: Integer controlling how many users to include in the training dataset.

data_variables.name: valid_num
data_variables.description: Integer controlling how many validation samples to keep per user.

data_flow.creation: Created using pd.read_csv to load from train.csv with specific data types and row limits.
data_flow.flows: Filtered to create data_q, which only contains question-type interactions.

data_flow.creation: Filtered from data to retain only rows where content_type_id is 0.
data_flow.flows: Used to create users_i_counts, user_list, train_data, and valid_data.

data_flow.creation: Generated by counting user IDs in data_q.

data_flow.flows: Used to select training and validation users for train_data and valid_data.

data_flow.creation: Constructed by concatenating data_q rows for selected user IDs excluding their last valid_num rows.
data_flow.flows: Can be used for model training.

data_flow.creation: Constructed by concatenating data_q rows for selected user IDs including their last valid_num rows.
data_flow.flows: Used for validation in model testing.
